Class GameBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameBoard

  • public class GameBoard
extends java.lang.Object
    Is board that is 8 by 8 and can hold pieces. Contains methods such as fillBoard, getGame, getLocation, getPlayer arrays, removing pieces from player array, turning and resetting gameBoard, etc.
    Version:
    May 28, 2019
    Author:
    Ajeet, Matthew, Period: 4th, Assignment: APCSFinalProject, Sources: NONE

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameBoard()
      Constructs a GameBoard object with a an 8 by 8 Gamepiece array.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void fillGameBoard(java.lang.String p1, java.lang.String p2)
      Fills the GamePiece array with pieces from player one and player two.
      GamePiece[][] getGame()
      Returns gamePiece array.
      Location getLocation(int x, int y)
      Returns the location in the GameBoard.
      java.util.ArrayList<GamePiece> getPlayerOnePieces()
      Returns an ArrayList containing all player one pieces.
      java.util.ArrayList<GamePiece> getPlayerTwoPieces()
      Returns an ArrayList containing all player two pieces.
      void removePlayerOnePiece(GamePiece target)
      Removes a GamePiece from the player one array if it exists.
      void removePlayerTwoPiece(GamePiece target)
      Removes a GamePiece from the player two array if it exists.
      void resetGameBoard()
      Resets the GamePieces to their original positions.
      boolean setGameBoard(GamePiece piece, Location newL)
      Determines whether piece can be moved to a new location.
      void turnGameBoard()
      Rotates the gamePiece array by 180 degrees.
